formalpara.title: Figure 14:
formalpara.para: Insulin, TGFβ, and cGMP signaling is necessary for normal satiety quiescence. A. Mutations in genes encoding the insulin receptor DAF-2, the TGFβ DAF-7, and DAF-7 receptor subunits DAF-1 and DAF-4 reduce quiescence. B. TAX-2, a subunit of the cGMP-gated cation channel, is necessary for satiety quiescence. Reproduced, with permission, from You et al. (2008).
